article:
I'll never forget the Christmas in 1946. My dad had died five years before and left Mom several school kids to   _  . A month before Christmas our church said they were   _   a special offering   to help a poor family. We quickly decided to help without   _  .
That month was one of the best of our lives. We'll remember it forever. We took any job that we could      _  and saved each penny. We   _   the money every day to see how much we had got. We talked about how   _   the poor family would be when they had the money. The day before Christmas we   _   all our coins for three $20 bills and one $10 bill. We felt we were very rich.
Then came the exciting Christmas morning. However, later that afternoon the minister   brought us a(n)  _  . Out of it fell some money --- three $20 bills, one $10 bill and seventeen $1 bills. Suddenly, we were   _   because we felt we had nothing.
That week I felt so  _  that I even wanted to leave school. Mom   _   us to church on Sunday although we didn't want to see anyone. A speaker was saying $100 would save a poor family in Africa. We became   _   for the first time in a week. Mom reached into her purse and   _   out the envelope. After a while the minister said excitedly that the offering was over $100. He hadn't expected such a large offering from our small   _  . He said, "There must be rich people here." Suddenly it hit us! We had given $87! We were the rich family! From that day on I've never been   _   again.
